subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Landing Page MVP
description: A quick win: understand The Landing Page MVP.

hook.text: Buffer's founder Joel Gascoigne had an idea for a social media scheduling tool. He built a webpage.

buildup.text: The page described the product and had a pricing button. The product didn't actually exist yet.

discovery.text: When people clicked 'Plans and Pricing,' he showed prices. If they clicked again, he collected emails.

twist.text: In 48 hours, he had enough email signups to know people would pay. Only then did he start coding.

climax.text: Buffer grew to millions in revenue. The whole business started with a two-page website and no product.

punchline.text: A landing page can answer a million-dollar question overnight.

quiz.question: How did Buffer's landing page MVP test willingness to pay?
options: By charging users a small fee to join a waitlist
By showing pricing and collecting emails from people who clicked through
By offering a free trial with limited features
